results.doc_title: PRD for different portion percentages in the funnel
results.project_name: Different Portion Percentages in the Funnel
results.summary: This project introduces 50%, 75%, and 100% portion percentage options for TPT dog food plans to align with mixed feeding habits practiced by over 80% of dog owners. The feature will replace the confusing 'Topper Plan' and be launched as an A/B test experiment to measure impact on conversion and revenue. Users will indicate mixed feeding preferences through a new quiz question, and portion options will apply to single-product plans (Fresh, Air-Dried, Pantry Fresh) while Mixed plans remain 100% only.

must_have: Remove 'Topper Plan' from plan selection flow
Add new quiz question to identify mixed feeders
Introduce 50%, 75%, and 100% portion options for Fresh and Air-Dried plans
Show portion percentages only to users who indicate mixed feeding in quiz
Apply portion options to single-product plans (Fresh, Air-Dried, Pantry Fresh)
Dynamic SKU mapping based on user's calculated caloric needs
Price comparison display for different portion percentages
Portion percentage selection in change plan flow for active users
Default selection logic based on user's mixed feeding answer
nice_to_have: Eventually extend to Pantry Fresh plans
out_of_scope: Mixed plan will remain 100% portion plan only
No portion percentages for users who indicate they don't want to mix (in some variations)

decisions.what: Run A/B/C test with 3 variations (Control, Variation 1, Variation 2)
decisions.rationale: To validate impact on conversion and revenue with different defaulting strategies

decisions.what: Show only 2 portion options on plans card in funnel
All active users see portion percentage options regardless of experiment allocation
decisions.rationale: Maintain consistent experience for existing customers

decisions.what: Default to smaller portion % for users who want to mix (Variation 1)
decisions.rationale: Align with stated mixed feeding preference

technical: Quiz system for new question integration
SKU mapping system for caloric needs calculation
Plans page UI for portion percentage display

success_metrics: Gross CVR from 1st question in funnel

results.summary: This project aims to create a Shopify storefront for Good Chop to experiment with item-based pricing, offering products through both one-time purchases and flexible subscriptions. The new marketplace will operate in parallel with the legacy site to gain insights into product uptake, order habits, customer lifetime value, and operational effectiveness while providing customers with more flexible ordering options.

must_have: Shopify storefront implementation
Item-based pricing capability
One-time purchase functionality
Flexible subscription options
Parallel operation with existing legacy site
Customer access to both legacy account portal and new storefront
Existing subscription management retention
Modern e-commerce experience for product discovery
nice_to_have: Premium vs standard cut pricing tiers
out_of_scope: Limiting customers from current account experience
Mandated customer redirection from legacy site

decisions.what: Parallel operational strategy - maintain both legacy and new Shopify storefront
decisions.rationale: Ensures seamless transition, maximum flexibility, mitigates disruption, respects customer familiarity, and puts control in customer hands without forcing migration

decisions.what: Use Shopify as the platform for new storefront
decisions.rationale: To overcome foundational gaps in current HelloFresh core technology regarding e-commerce funnels, multiple subscriptions, and one-time purchases

decisions.what: Launch timing in Q1 (March) to get insights before Q2
decisions.rationale: Minimum 2 weeks needed for campaigns to have insight into performance

technical: Factor Form (testing ground for e-commerce capabilities)
Customer portal and account management interface

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.role: Current core technology platform with limitations

results.summary: This project aims to revamp the sign up experience on ThePetsTable to help customers move forward quickly and confidently to place their orders. The focus is on improving the sign up CTA and adding social proof elements rather than removing the registration page, as data shows minimal customer drop-off at this stage compared to HelloFresh.

must_have: Improve sign up CTA to move from transactional to emotional tone
Add social proof and product stats from real customers (e.g., 'Loved by 200k+ Golden retrievers', 'Made in USA', 'Improved immune system')
Implement passwordless sign up option
Keep the registration page (not remove it)
Maintain email autopopulation from WKND cookie
Keep Add-ons promotional banner

decisions.rationale: Registration page is necessary to verify if prospect already has an account, helps redirect existing users to reactivation page, prevents redundant navigation through signup funnel. Data shows minimal drop-off (12.25% visited address vs 11.62% visited registration) compared to HelloFresh (55% drop-off).

Two experiments with seasonal promotional banners in similar location showed positive CVR improvements. Customers learn about Add-ons for first time on sign up page. Team lacks experimental bandwidth to test alternatives.

decisions.what: Prioritize passwordless sign up over social logins
decisions.rationale: HelloFresh saw 0.8% conversion improvement with passwordless. Social logins (P2 priority) expected to have low impact as 50%+ customers are 50+ years old and less likely to use social logins, despite HelloFresh seeing 2.66% improvement.

technical: Statsig for passwordless sign up implementation

success_metrics: Conversion rate from registration page to address page
Session progression from 'Visited Registration' to 'Visited Address'

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.role: Comparison benchmark for registration page performance and feature impact

entities.name: New Ventures TPT
entities.role: Strategic initiative to drive $6M incremental CVA

entities.name: Statsig
entities.role: Experimentation platform referenced for passwordless sign up

results.summary: This project aims to revamp the sign-up experience on ThePetsTable to help customers move forward quickly and confidently to place their orders. The focus is on optimizing the registration page UI to move from a transactional tone to an emotional tone, improving customer intent to complete checkout while maintaining the necessary verification functionality.

must_have: Keep the registration page (necessary to verify if prospect already has an account)
Maintain email autopopulation from WKND cookie
Redirect existing users to reactivation page with applicable discounts
Improve sign-up CTA to increase customer intent
nice_to_have: Social logins (Apple, Google, Facebook) - P2 priority, 8 pts effort, low impact expected
Optimize page UI to move from transactional to emotional tone
Test moving below-the-fold elements (social proof, product stats) to banner location
out_of_scope: Removal of the registration page entirely
Removing Add-ons promotional banner (decided to keep)

decisions.what: Keep the registration page instead of removing it
decisions.rationale: Registration page is necessary to verify whether a prospect already has an account, helps redirect existing users to reactivation page, prevents redundant navigation through signup funnel. Data shows registration page adds little friction (12.25% visited Address vs 11.62% visited Registration).

Two experiments with seasonal promotional banners in similar location resulted in positive CVR improvements. Customers learn about Add-ons for first time on sign-up page and create intent to buy during checkout. Team lacks experimental bandwidth for testing alternatives.

While HelloFresh saw 2.66% conversion increase with social logins, ThePetsTable customer demographics are much older (>50% are 50+ years old) who are less likely to use social logins. Expected low impact with 8 pts effort.

technical: Site cookies for logged-in session management
Social login APIs (Apple, Google, Facebook) - if P2 implemented

success_metrics: Conversion rate from Registration to Address page
Session progression: Visited Registration to Visited Address percentage

results.summary: Initiative to establish a Golden Path for AI-Native Product Development Lifecycle across the organization. The project focuses on enabling teams with AI-assisted development tools, spec-driven development methodology, and creating a framework for AI-first product development. Key activities include AI Office Hours, Claude Code workshops, and onboarding teams to new development practices.

must_have: AI-Native Product Development Handbook
Golden Path for AI-Native PDLC
Spec-driven development methodology
/qa-test command functionality
AI Office Hours program
Claude Code for Product Management Workshop
ChatGPT App PoC integration
FreshChat integration in HelloDev
AI Agent Platform launch
nice_to_have: Video recordings of sessions for YouTube shorts
Templated outbound efforts (daily tips, office hours, workshops)

decisions.what: Focus on AI-First vs. AI-Augmented approach
decisions.rationale: Why Focus Wins - discussed in Dec 15, 2025 agenda
Teams should focus on spec-driven development vs. current practices
Enable HF Discovery MCP / ChatGPT App Integration

success_metrics: 50% booking rate for AI Office Hours
Reduction in web marketing campaign issues
